oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prevalence of Intramammary Infections in Beef Heifers at Parturition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roberson, J. R.
Bailey, T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: intramammary infections
parturition
elective caesareans
prevalence
beef heifer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The prevalence of intramammary infections (IMI) in dairy heifers at parturition has been determined at several sites both within the USA and worldwide. To our knowledge, a study regarding the prevalence of IMI in beef heifers at parturition has not been performed. Because of a large number of elective caesareans in beef heifers, we were presented with the opportunity to determine the prevalence of beef heifer IMI at parturition.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1998; 227-228
